org.jcvi.jillion.fasta.nt

Interface NucleotideFastaDataStore

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Closeable, DataStore<NucleotideFastaRecord>, FastaDataStore<Nucleotide,NucleotideSequence,NucleotideFastaRecord,NucleotideSequenceDataStore>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    NucleotideFastaFileDataStore
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AdaptedNucleotideFastaDataStore

    public interface NucleotideFastaDataStore
extends FastaDataStore<Nucleotide,NucleotideSequence,NucleotideFastaRecord,NucleotideSequenceDataStore>
    NucleotideFastaDataStore is a FastaDataStore for storing Nucleotides.
    Author:
    dkatzel

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default NucleotideSequenceDataStore asSequenceDataStore()
      Return a new DataStore is a "view" of just the Sequences from this datastore.
      default NucleotideSequence getSubSequence(String id, long startOffset)
      Get just the part of the Sequence of the given record starting from the given start offset (0-based) until the end of the sequence.
      default NucleotideSequence getSubSequence(String id, Range includeRange)

    • Method Detail

      • asSequenceDataStore

        default NucleotideSequenceDataStore asSequenceDataStore()
        Description copied from interface: FastaDataStore
        Return a new DataStore is a "view" of just the Sequences from this datastore. This Fasta DataStore is the backing datastore so all calls to the returned Sequence Datastore will delegate to this fasta datastore and then get adapted to return just the sequence. When this fasta datastore closes, the returned datastore will also close and vice versa. Closing this datastore will close the other as well.
        Specified by:
        asSequenceDataStore in interface FastaDataStore<Nucleotide,NucleotideSequence,NucleotideFastaRecord,NucleotideSequenceDataStore>
        Returns:
        A new DataStore instance which is a linked view of this Fasta DataStore but adapted so that all the records will just be the sequences.

      • getSubSequence

        default NucleotideSequence getSubSequence(String id,
                                          long startOffset)
                                   throws DataStoreException
        Description copied from interface: FastaDataStore
        Get just the part of the Sequence of the given record starting from the given start offset (0-based) until the end of the sequence.
        Specified by:
        getSubSequence in interface FastaDataStore<Nucleotide,NucleotideSequence,NucleotideFastaRecord,NucleotideSequenceDataStore>
        Parameters:
        id - the Id of the record to get; can not be null.
        startOffset - the start Offset to use
        Returns:
        the Sequence for that ID if it exists; or null if the ID does not exist.
        Throws:
        DataStoreException - if there is a problem getting the sequence.

      • getSubSequence

        default NucleotideSequence getSubSequence(String id,
                                          Range includeRange)
                                   throws DataStoreException
        Description copied from interface: FastaDataStore
        Get just the part of the Sequence of the given record that intersects the given Range. If the Range is beyond the entire sequence, an empty sequence should be returned.
        Specified by:
        getSubSequence in interface FastaDataStore<Nucleotide,NucleotideSequence,NucleotideFastaRecord,NucleotideSequenceDataStore>
        Parameters:
        id - the Id of the record to get; can not be null.
        includeRange - the subSequence Range to use; can not be null.
        Returns:
        the Sequence for that ID if it exists; or null if the ID does not exist.
        Throws:
        DataStoreException - if there is a problem getting the sequence.
